intro: Licania gonzalezii, commonly known as the Gonzalez's licania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Licania gonzalezii is often found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
